titleStmt.title: Remarks upon the most eminent of our antimonarchical authors and their writings viz. 1. the brief history of succession, 2. Plato redevivus, 3. Mr. Hunt's Postscript, 4. Mr. Johnson's Julian, 5. Mr. Sidney's Papers, 6. upon the consequences of them, conspiracies and rebellions / published long since, and what may serve for answer to Mr. Sidney's late publication of government &c.

Remarks upon the most eminent of our antimonarchical authors and their writings viz. 1. the brief history of succession, 2. Plato redevivus, 3. Mr. Hunt's Postscript, 4. Mr. Johnson's Julian, 5. Mr. Sidney's Papers, 6. upon the consequences of them, conspiracies and rebellions / published long since, and what may serve for answer to Mr. Sidney's late publication of government &c.
titleStmt.author: Neville, Henry, 1620-1694. Plato redivivus.
Johnson, Samuel, 1649-1703. Julian the apostate.
Sidney, Algernon, 1622-1683. Discourses concerning government.
Hunt, Thomas, 1627?-1688. Postscript for rectifying some mistakes in some of the inferiour clergy.

publicationStmt.publisher: Sold by the booksellers of London and Westminster,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Huntington Library.
